info.title: KeyVaultManagementClient
info.description: The Azure management API provides a RESTful set of web services that interact with Azure Key Vault.

get.description: List the operations for the provider

post.description: Checks that the managed hsm name is valid and is not already in use.

parameters.name: mhsmName
parameters.description: The request body

post.description: Checks that the vault name is valid and is not already in use.

parameters.name: vaultName
parameters.description: The name of the vault.

get.description: The List operation gets information about the deleted managed HSMs associated with the subscription.
Gets information about the deleted vaults in a subscription.
Gets the specified deleted managed HSM.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the deleted managed HSM.

post.description: Permanently deletes the specified managed HSM.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the deleted managed HSM.

Location.description: The Location header contains the URL where the status of the long running operation can be checked.

Retry-After.description: The Retry-After header can indicate how long the client should wait before polling the operation status.

parameters.description: The name of the Managed HSM Pool within the specified resource group.

parameters.name: keyName
parameters.description: The name of the key to be created. The value you provide may be copied globally for the purpose of running the service. The value provided should not include personally identifiable or sensitive information.

put.description: Creates the first version of a new key if it does not exist. If it already exists, then the existing key is returned without any write operations being performed. This API does not create subsequent versions, and does not update existing keys.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the Managed HSM Pool within the specified resource group.

parameters.name: keyName
parameters.description: The name of the key to be created. The value you provide may be copied globally for the purpose of running the service. The value provided should not include personally identifiable or sensitive information.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: The parameters used to create the specified key.

parameters.description: Azure Resource Manager Api Version.

AccessPolicyEntry.description: An identity that have access to the key vault. All identities in the array must use the same tenant ID as the key vault's tenant ID.

tenantId.description: The Azure Active Directory tenant ID that should be used for authenticating requests to the key vault.

objectId.description: The object ID of a user, service principal or security group in the Azure Active Directory tenant for the vault. The object ID must be unique for the list of access policies.

applicationId.description: Application ID of the client making request on behalf of a principal

permissions.description: Permissions the identity has for keys, secrets and certificates.

ActionsRequired.description: A message indicating if changes on the service provider require any updates on the consumer.

values.name: Active
values.description: The managed HSM Pool is active.

values.name: NotActivated
values.description: The managed HSM Pool is not yet activated.

values.name: Unknown
values.description: An unknown error occurred while activating managed hsm.

Attributes.description: The object attributes managed by the KeyVault service.

enabled.description: Determines whether the object is enabled.

nbf.description: Not before date in seconds since 1970-01-01T00:00:00Z.

updated.description: Last updated time in seconds since 1970-01-01T00:00:00Z.

Azure.Core.azureLocation.description: Represents an Azure geography region where supported resource providers live.

Azure.Core.eTag.description:
The ETag (or entity tag) HTTP response header is an identifier for a specific version of a resource.
It lets caches be more efficient and save bandwidth, as a web server does not need to resend a full response if the content was not changed.

It is a string of ASCII characters placed between double quotes, like "675af34563dc-tr34".

CheckMhsmNameAvailabilityParameters.description: The parameters used to check the availability of the managed hsm name.

nameAvailable.description: A boolean value that indicates whether the name is available for you to use. If true, the name is available. If false, the name has already been taken or is invalid and cannot be used.

reason.description: The reason that a managed hsm name could not be used. The reason element is only returned if NameAvailable is false.

message.description: An error message explaining the Reason value in more detail.

nameAvailable.description: A boolean value that indicates whether the name is available for you to use. If true, the name is available. If false, the name has already been taken or is invalid and cannot be used.

reason.description: The reason that a vault name could not be used. The Reason element is only returned if NameAvailable is false.

message.description: An error message explaining the Reason value in more detail.

CloudError.description: An error response from Key Vault resource provider

error.description: An error response from Key Vault resource provider

CloudErrorBody.description: An error response from Key Vault resource provider

code.description: Error code. This is a mnemonic that can be consumed programmatically.

message.description: User friendly error message. The message is typically localized and may vary with service version.

CreateMode.description: The vault's create mode to indicate whether the vault need to be recovered or not.

DeletedManagedHsm.description: Concrete proxy resource types can be created by aliasing this type using a specific property type.

location.description: The location of the original managed HSM.

purgeProtectionEnabled.description: Purge protection status of the original managed HSM.

tags.description: Tags of the original managed HSM.

location.description: The location of the original vault.

purgeProtectionEnabled.description: Purge protection status of the original vault.

DeletionRecoveryLevel.description: The deletion recovery level currently in effect for the object. If it contains 'Purgeable', then the object can be permanently deleted by a privileged user; otherwise, only the system can purge the object at the end of the retention interval.

DimensionProperties.description: Type of operation: get, read, delete, etc.

toBeExportedForShoebox.description: Property to specify whether the dimension should be exported for Shoebox.

innererror.description: The inner error, contains a more specific error code.

IPRule.description: A rule governing the accessibility of a vault from a specific ip address or ip range.

value.description: An IPv4 address range in CIDR notation, such as '124.56.78.91' (simple IP address) or '124.56.78.0/24' (all addresses that start with 124.56.78).

JsonWebKeyCurveName.description: The elliptic curve name. For valid values, see JsonWebKeyCurveName. Default for EC and EC-HSM keys is P-256

JsonWebKeyOperation.description: The permitted JSON web key operations of the key. For more information, see JsonWebKeyOperation.

JsonWebKeyType.description: The type of the key. For valid values, see JsonWebKeyType.

location.description: The supported Azure location where the managed HSM Pool should be created.

KeyAttributes.description: The object attributes managed by the Azure Key Vault service.

enabled.description: Determines whether or not the object is enabled.

nbf.description: Not before date in seconds since 1970-01-01T00:00:00Z.

updated.description: Last updated time in seconds since 1970-01-01T00:00:00Z.

recoveryLevel.description: The deletion recovery level currently in effect for the object. If it contains 'Purgeable', then the object can be permanently deleted by a privileged user; otherwise, only the system can purge the object at the end of the retention interval.

exportable.description: Indicates if the private key can be exported.

KeyCreateParameters.description: The parameters used to create a key.

tags.description: The tags that will be assigned to the key.

properties.description: The properties of the key to be created.

KeyListResult.description: The response of a Key list operation.

value.description: The Key items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

kty.description: The type of the key. For valid values, see JsonWebKeyType.

keySize.description: The key size in bits. For example: 2048, 3072, or 4096 for RSA. Default for RSA and RSA-HSM keys is 2048. Exception made for bring your own key (BYOK), key exchange keys default to 4096.

curveName.description: The elliptic curve name. For valid values, see JsonWebKeyCurveName. Default for EC and EC-HSM keys is P-256

keyUri.description: The URI to retrieve the current version of the key.

keyUriWithVersion.description: The URI to retrieve the specific version of the key.

rotationPolicy.description: Key rotation policy in response. It will be used for both output and input. Omitted if empty

release_policy.description: Key release policy in response. It will be used for both output and input. Omitted if empty

contentType.description: Content type and version of key release policy

data.description: Blob encoding the policy rules under which the key can be released.

updated.description: Last updated time in seconds since 1970-01-01T00:00:00Z.

expiryTime.description: The expiration time for the new key version. It should be in ISO8601 format. Eg: 'P90D', 'P1Y'.

trigger.description: The trigger of key rotation policy lifetimeAction.

action.description: The action of key rotation policy lifetimeAction.

MHSMGeoReplicatedRegion.description: A region that this managed HSM Pool has been extended to.

name.description: Name of the geo replicated region.

provisioningState.description: Provisioning state of the geo replicated region.

isPrimary.description: A boolean value that indicates whether the region is the primary region or a secondary region.

MHSMIPRule.description: A rule governing the accessibility of a managed HSM pool from a specific IP address or IP range.

value.description: An IPv4 address range in CIDR notation, such as '124.56.78.91' (simple IP address) or '124.56.78.0/24' (all addresses that start with 124.56.78).

MHSMNetworkRuleSet.description: A set of rules governing the network accessibility of a managed hsm pool.

bypass.description: Tells what traffic can bypass network rules. This can be 'AzureServices' or 'None'.  If not specified the default is 'AzureServices'.

defaultAction.description: The default action when no rule from ipRules and from virtualNetworkRules match. This is only used after the bypass property has been evaluated.

ipRules.description: The list of IP address rules.

virtualNetworkRules.description: The list of virtual network rules.

id.description: Full identifier of the private endpoint resource.

etag.description: Modified whenever there is a change in the state of private endpoint connection.

location.description: The geo-location where the resource lives

ManagedHsmProperties.description: Properties of the managed HSM Pool

tenantId.description: The Azure Active Directory tenant ID that should be used for authenticating requests to the managed HSM pool.

initialAdminObjectIds.description: Array of initial administrators object ids for this managed hsm pool.

hsmUri.description: The URI of the managed hsm pool for performing operations on keys.

enableSoftDelete.description: Property to specify whether the 'soft delete' functionality is enabled for this managed HSM pool. Soft delete is enabled by default for all managed HSMs and is immutable.

softDeleteRetentionInDays.description: Soft deleted data retention days. When you delete an HSM or a key, it will remain recoverable for the configured retention period or for a default period of 90 days. It accepts values between 7 and 90.

enablePurgeProtection.description: Property specifying whether protection against purge is enabled for this managed HSM pool. Setting this property to true activates protection against purge for this managed HSM pool and its content - only the Managed HSM service may initiate a hard, irrecoverable deletion. Enabling this functionality is irreversible.

createMode.description: The create mode to indicate whether the resource is being created or is being recovered from a deleted resource.

networkAcls.description: Rules governing the accessibility of the key vault from specific network locations.

regions.description: List of all regions associated with the managed hsm pool.

privateEndpointConnections.description: List of private endpoint connections associated with the managed hsm pool.

publicNetworkAccess.description: Control permission to the managed HSM from public networks.

scheduledPurgeDate.description: The scheduled purge date in UTC.

attributes.description: The attributes of key rotation policy.

lifetimeActions.description: The lifetimeActions for key rotation action.

family.description: SKU Family of the managed HSM Pool

name.description: SKU of the managed HSM Pool

ManagedHsmSkuFamily.description: SKU Family of the managed HSM Pool

ManagedHsmSkuName.description: SKU of the managed HSM Pool

timeAfterCreate.description: The time duration after key creation to rotate the key. It only applies to rotate. It will be in ISO 8601 duration format. Eg: 'P90D', 'P1Y'.

timeBeforeExpiry.description: The time duration before key expiring to rotate or notify. It will be in ISO 8601 duration format. Eg: 'P90D', 'P1Y'.

unit.description: The metric unit. Possible values include: 'Bytes', 'Count', 'Milliseconds'.

aggregationType.description: The metric aggregation type. Possible values include: 'Average', 'Count', 'Total'.

supportedAggregationTypes.description: The supported aggregation types for the metrics.

supportedTimeGrainTypes.description: The supported time grain types for the metrics.

fillGapWithZero.description: Property to specify whether to fill gap with zero.

NetworkRuleAction.description: The default action when no rule from ipRules and from virtualNetworkRules match. This is only used after the bypass property has been evaluated.

NetworkRuleBypassOptions.description: Tells what traffic can bypass network rules. This can be 'AzureServices' or 'None'.  If not specified the default is 'AzureServices'.

NetworkRuleSet.description: A set of rules governing the network accessibility of a vault.

bypass.description: Tells what traffic can bypass network rules. This can be 'AzureServices' or 'None'.  If not specified the default is 'AzureServices'.

defaultAction.description: The default action when no rule from ipRules and from virtualNetworkRules match. This is only used after the bypass property has been evaluated.

ipRules.description: The list of IP address rules.

virtualNetworkRules.description: The list of virtual network rules.

Operation.description: Key Vault REST API operation definition.

display.description: Display metadata associated with the operation.

properties.description: Properties of operation, include metric specifications.

isDataAction.description: Property to specify whether the action is a data action.

OperationDisplay.description: Display metadata associated with the operation.

resource.description: Resource on which the operation is performed etc.

operation.description: Type of operation: get, read, delete, etc.

OperationListResult.description: Result of the request to list Storage operations. It contains a list of operations and a URL link to get the next set of results.

values.name: Succeeded
values.description: The managed HSM Pool has been full provisioned.

values.name: Provisioning
values.description: The managed HSM Pool is currently being provisioned.

values.name: Failed
values.description: Provisioning of the managed HSM Pool has failed.

values.name: Updating
values.description: The managed HSM Pool is currently being updated.

values.name: Deleting
values.description: The managed HSM Pool is currently being deleted.

values.name: Activated
values.description: The managed HSM pool is ready for normal use.

values.name: SecurityDomainRestore
values.description: The managed HSM pool is waiting for a security domain restore action.

values.name: Restoring
values.description: The managed HSM pool is being restored from full HSM backup.

timeAfterCreate.description: The time duration after key creation to rotate the key. It only applies to rotate. It will be in ISO 8601 duration format. Eg: 'P90D', 'P1Y'.

timeBeforeExpiry.description: The time duration before key expiring to rotate or notify. It will be in ISO 8601 duration format. Eg: 'P90D', 'P1Y'.

value.description: The Vault items on this page

VaultPatchParameters.description: Parameters for creating or updating a vault

tags.description: The tags that will be assigned to the key vault.

tenantId.description: The Azure Active Directory tenant ID that should be used for authenticating requests to the key vault.

accessPolicies.description: An array of 0 to 16 identities that have access to the key vault. All identities in the array must use the same tenant ID as the key vault's tenant ID.

enabledForDeployment.description: Property to specify whether Azure Virtual Machines are permitted to retrieve certificates stored as secrets from the key vault.

enabledForDiskEncryption.description: Property to specify whether Azure Disk Encryption is permitted to retrieve secrets from the vault and unwrap keys.

enabledForTemplateDeployment.description: Property to specify whether Azure Resource Manager is permitted to retrieve secrets from the key vault.

enableSoftDelete.description: Property to specify whether the 'soft delete' functionality is enabled for this key vault. Once set to true, it cannot be reverted to false.

enableRbacAuthorization.description: Property that controls how data actions are authorized. When true, the key vault will use Role Based Access Control (RBAC) for authorization of data actions, and the access policies specified in vault properties will be  ignored. When false, the key vault will use the access policies specified in vault properties, and any policy stored on Azure Resource Manager will be ignored. If null or not specified, the value of this property will not change.

softDeleteRetentionInDays.description: softDelete data retention days. It accepts >=7 and <=90.

createMode.description: The vault's create mode to indicate whether the vault need to be recovered or not.

enablePurgeProtection.description: Property specifying whether protection against purge is enabled for this vault. Setting this property to true activates protection against purge for this vault and its content - only the Key Vault service may initiate a hard, irrecoverable deletion. The setting is effective only if soft delete is also enabled. Enabling this functionality is irreversible - that is, the property does not accept false as its value.

networkAcls.description: A collection of rules governing the accessibility of the vault from specific network locations.

publicNetworkAccess.description: Property to specify whether the vault will accept traffic from public internet. If set to 'disabled' all traffic except private endpoint traffic and that that originates from trusted services will be blocked. This will override the set firewall rules, meaning that even if the firewall rules are present we will not honor the rules.

tenantId.description: The Azure Active Directory tenant ID that should be used for authenticating requests to the key vault.

accessPolicies.description: An array of 0 to 1024 identities that have access to the key vault. All identities in the array must use the same tenant ID as the key vault's tenant ID. When `createMode` is set to `recover`, access policies are not required. Otherwise, access policies are required.

vaultUri.description: The URI of the vault for performing operations on keys and secrets.

hsmPoolResourceId.description: The resource id of HSM Pool.

enabledForDeployment.description: Property to specify whether Azure Virtual Machines are permitted to retrieve certificates stored as secrets from the key vault.

enabledForDiskEncryption.description: Property to specify whether Azure Disk Encryption is permitted to retrieve secrets from the vault and unwrap keys.

enabledForTemplateDeployment.description: Property to specify whether Azure Resource Manager is permitted to retrieve secrets from the key vault.

enableSoftDelete.description: Property to specify whether the 'soft delete' functionality is enabled for this key vault. If it's not set to any value(true or false) when creating new key vault, it will be set to true by default. Once set to true, it cannot be reverted to false.

softDeleteRetentionInDays.description: softDelete data retention days. It accepts >=7 and <=90.

enableRbacAuthorization.description: Property that controls how data actions are authorized. When true, the key vault will use Role Based Access Control (RBAC) for authorization of data actions, and the access policies specified in vault properties will be  ignored. When false, the key vault will use the access policies specified in vault properties, and any policy stored on Azure Resource Manager will be ignored. If null or not specified, the vault is created with the default value of false. Note that management actions are always authorized with RBAC.

createMode.description: The vault's create mode to indicate whether the vault need to be recovered or not.

enablePurgeProtection.description: Property specifying whether protection against purge is enabled for this vault. Setting this property to true activates protection against purge for this vault and its content - only the Key Vault service may initiate a hard, irrecoverable deletion. The setting is effective only if soft delete is also enabled. Enabling this functionality is irreversible - that is, the property does not accept false as its value.

networkAcls.description: Rules governing the accessibility of the key vault from specific network locations.

privateEndpointConnections.description: List of private endpoint connections associated with the key vault.

publicNetworkAccess.description: Property to specify whether the vault will accept traffic from public internet. If set to 'disabled' all traffic except private endpoint traffic and that that originates from trusted services will be blocked. This will override the set firewall rules, meaning that even if the firewall rules are present we will not honor the rules.

VirtualNetworkRule.description: A rule governing the accessibility of a vault from a specific virtual network.

id.description: Full resource id of a vnet subnet, such as '/subscriptions/subid/resourceGroups/rg1/providers/Microsoft.Network/virtualNetworks/test-vnet/subnets/subnet1'.

ignoreMissingVnetServiceEndpoint.description: Property to specify whether NRP will ignore the check if parent subnet has serviceEndpoints configured.
